isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB - TILT: 9600 AND 9700 SLEEPER AND NON-SLEEPER CABS - SHEET METAL REPAIRS - SELECT AND INSTALL RIVETS

step1.para: If panel is accessible from both sides, use a Lockbolt fastener of same diameter as rivet previously removed. If panel is accessible from one side only, use a 1/4 inch (6.35mm) Monobolt [or a 1/4 inch (6.35mm) "Cherry G" rivet where required. See Figure 52 ].

In some severe cases, rivet holes may be too enlarged from damage, etc., to permit proper rivet installation. If you suspect that a rivet hole may be too large, check the hole with a new rivet. If the rivet hole is too large, weld the rivet hole shut, and metal finish the welded hole. When installing the new panel, drill panel and cab and install proper rivet in the same area that was welded.

note.para:
The grip range (combined thickness of panels, reinforcements, framework, etc., being riveted) is also important. Be sure to select the correct size rivet for the job it must do. Refer to Table 2
.

step1.para: Using a drill bit of same size as rivet selected (Monobolt or Lockbolt), redrill pilot hole at each rivet hole location. Drill four or five holes at one time and install that number of rivets.
Insert Monobolt in special installing tool and install Monobolt to panel ( Figure 70).
Continue this procedure until all rivets are installed. Check panel fit intermittently so as to avoid any panel distortion or dimpling.
Clean up any sealant from panel edges and rivets.
